verb.description: To put into, or on board, a ship again; to transfer to another ship; to transport back or elsewhere by ship.
Originally US. To transport back or elsewhere by rail, road, or air; to dispatch (goods) by these means for a second or subsequent time. Also occasionally without object. Compare "ship".
To set in position, fix up, again, especially on a ship or boat.

origin: Early 17th century. From re- + ship. Compare earlier reshipping and the foreign-language forms cited at that entry. Compare earlier unship.
